wikipedia_page.main: Jim Reid (5 May 1934 – 6 July 2009) was a Scottish folk musician who was born in Dundee. Many of his songs are about his home town of Dundee and the people and places of the surrounding county of Angus.

response: The Wild Geese, which takes the form of a conversation between the poet and the North Wind, is a sad poem of longing for home. It was set to music as Norlan' Wind and popularised by Angus singer and songmaker Jim Reid,"Jim Reid: The Norland Wind/ The Wild Geese" at springthyme.co.uk who also set to music other poems by Jacob and other Angus poets such as Marion Angus and Helen Cruikshank."Norlan' Wind (The Wild Geese)" at educationscotland.gov.uk Another version, sung by Cilla Fisher and Artie Trezise, appeared on their 1979 Topic Records album Cilla and Artie. Traditional folk band Malinky are among many other artists who have released versions of Norland Wind.

Critics noted the influence on the album of iconic artists such as Leonard Cohen, Will Oldham, Bill Callahan, Jason Molina, Jim Reid (folk musician), Alasdair Roberts and Neil Young as well as the dark, sparse Southern gothic prose of Cormac McCarthy and the surreal fantasy of Alasdair Gray. Anthony has also spoken of the influence that landscape and nature has on his writing, specifically the scenery of his native Aberdeenshire and the mountains of the Bernese Alps.
